p: The α subunits of the Ca 2+ and Na + channels are about four times as large as the K +-channel subunits and possess four sequence repeats, with each repeat being homologous to the single subunit in the homotetrameric K + channels (compare Fig. 10.1007/978-3-319-30012-2_6 and 10.1007/978-3-319-30012-2_6). There are five types of Ca 2+ channels (L, N, P, Q and T), and at least six types of Na + channels (I, II, III, µ1, H1 and PN3).
